page.title: 02Buckden Village
page.content: Buckden lies five miles south of Huntingdon and sixty miles north of London on the Great North Road. No one Knows why the village has grown on this spot but it is possibly due to the crossing point of the Gt. Ouse at Offord. Since the rapid growth of housing estates in the 1970's along with the building of the bypass the village has become a residential area for people working both locally and further afield. The village population having grown to four thousand. The biggest historical landmark is Buckden Towers, once Buckden Palace where Catherine of Aragon was imprisoned in the 1500's. Today Buckden is a lively village with many events taking place for all age groups throughout the year.
